newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's executive salaries lag Australia's - survey.
newsitem.headline: NZ's executive salaries lag Australia's - survey.

text.p: An executives' salaries survey has found that senior New Zealand managers are markedly lower paid than their Australian equivalents, Hay Management Consultants said on Monday.

The survey by the Auckland-based group showed a chief or senior executive of a large New Zealand-based organisation (with turnover in excess of NZ$1 billion) is paid up to 40 percent less in terms of base salary than an Australian counterpart.

At the other end of the scale, a chief executive of a small New Zealand-based oraganisation (typically with turnover of $20-$30 million) earns about 35 percent less than an equivalent across the Tasman.
Larger New Zealand organisations were more competitive with their Australian counterparts once bonus payments were included, although they still lagged behind Australian salaries by 19 percent.
In smaller companies, bonuses did not improve New Zealand managers' relative salaries.
Hay Management Consultants surveyed 180 medium to large size companies on each side of the Tasman in October.
